SEARCH
Package model

Class Toy

java.lang.Object
model.Toy
Direct Known Subclasses:
Animals, BoardGames, Figures, Puzzles
public abstract class Toy extends Object
Abstract superclass representing a general toy. Serves as the base for specific toy types (e.g., Figure, Animal, Puzzle, BoardGame). Contains common attributes and methods shared across different toy types. Each subclass must implement specific behavior for `getToyType` and `toDataString`.
Version:
3.0
Author:
Justin, Fatema, Manveet

  • Constructor Details

    • Toy

      public Toy(String sn, String name, String brand, double price, int availableCount, int ageAppropriate)
      Constructor for creating a Toy with common attributes.
      Parameters:
      sn - Unique serial number for the toy.
      name - Name of the toy.
      brand - Brand name of the toy.
      price - Price of the toy, assumed to be validated externally.
      availableCount - Stock count for the toy.
      ageAppropriate - Minimum age appropriate for the toy.

  • Method Details

    • getSn

      public String getSn()
      Gets the serial number of the toy.
      Returns:
      the serial number of the toy as a String.

    • setSn

      public void setSn(String sn)
      Sets the serial number of the toy.
      Parameters:
      sn - the serial number to set. This should be a unique identifier for each toy.

      public String getName()
      Gets the name of the toy.
      Returns:
      the name of the toy as a String.

      Parameters:

      public void setAvailableCount(int availableCount)
      Sets the available stock count of the toy.
      Parameters:
      availableCount - the available stock count to set. This should be a non-negative integer representing the number of toys in stock.

    • getAgeAppropriate

      public int getAgeAppropriate()
      Gets the minimum appropriate age for the toy.
      Returns:
      the minimum age for which the toy is deemed appropriate.

    • setAgeAppropriate

      public void setAgeAppropriate(int ageAppropriate)
      Sets the minimum appropriate age for the toy.
      Parameters:
      ageAppropriate - the minimum age appropriate for the toy. This should be a non-negative integer representing the age suitability.

    • getToyType

      public abstract String getToyType()
      Abstract method for getting the toy type as a string. Must be implemented by subclasses to return the specific type of the toy.
      Returns:
      the type of the toy (e.g., "Figure", "Animal").

    • toDataString

      public abstract String toDataString()
      Abstract method for saving toy data to a file-compatible format. Each subclass should implement this method to return a formatted string representing the toy's data for saving to a file.
      Returns:
      a string formatted for saving to `toys.txt`

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a formatted string representing the toy's details, including category, serial number, name, price, available count, and minimum appropriate age. This format is designed to be useful for displaying search results and inventory details.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string representation of the toy's details in the format: "Toy Type: [Toy Type], Serial Number: [SN], Name: [Name], Price: [Price], Available Count: [Count], Age Appropriate: [Age]"
